intro: Tylostemon corbisieri, commonly known as the mountain gum tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for native fauna. Its ornamental value has also made it a subject of horticultural interest.
